Candidate :  XIAOYUE WANG  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Germany - Heidelberg  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
 
2020 – 2022 ESSEC & MANNHEIM Executive MBA program at Mannheim Business School  
Capstone Strategic Project: Accelerating Commercialization of Living Therapies – POCare service for 
CAR -T Therapy  
• Successfully influenced and recruited 6 team members to form a multi -skill team.  
• CAR -T Cell Therapy CDMO market research  
• Define business activity of the CDMO and develop competitive advantage strategy.  
• Develop ROI/profitability strategy.  
• Develop global market entry and regulatory registration strategies.  
• Develop market expans ion and global Go -To-Market business strategies.  
• Develop a solid business plan.  
 
2007 – 2011 PhD at Max -Planck Institute   
  
Candidate :  XIAOYUE WANG  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Germany - Heidelberg  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
 
2020 – 2022 ESSEC & MANNHEIM Executive MBA program at Mannheim Business School  
Capstone Strategic Project: Accelerating Commercialization of Living Therapies – POCare service for 
CAR -T Therapy  
• Successfully influenced and recruited 6 team members to form a multi -skill team.  
• CAR -T Cell Therapy CDMO market research  
• Define business activity of the CDMO and develop competitive advantage strategy.  
• Develop ROI/profitability strategy.  
• Develop global market entry and regulatory registration strategies.  
• Develop market expans ion and global Go -To-Market business strategies.  
• Develop a solid business plan.  
 
2007 – 2011 PhD at Max -Planck Institute of Developmental Biology Tübingen, Germany  
2005 – 2007 Master of Growth Regulation Control / Graduate School of Medicine, Kyôto Univer sity, 
Japan  
2001 – 2005 Bachelor of Biochemistry / Applied Life Sciences Kyôto University, Japan  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2021 – date Vela Diagnostics Germany GmbH  
Position: Director of Business Development Oncology  
Responsible for the oncology diagnostic product market entry in the EMEA market  
• Develop IVDR and reimbursement  strategy for clinical diagnostics  
• Develop CDx strategy and implementation with Pharma  
• Validation in clinical diagnostics studies with reference customers  
• Develop go -to-market strategies and oversee business development activities across EMEA 
countri es 
 
 2017 – 2021 Molecular Health GmbH  
 
2019 - 2021  
Position:  Vice President of Business Development & Sales  
In addition to existing tasks and responsibilities:  
• International business development activities related to biotech companies, investors, clinical 
diagnostic labs,  distributors and pharmaceutical companies.  
• Developed country specific CDx or IVD strategies for market entries of CE -IVD products.  
• Successfully developed go -to-market strategy and implementation for CE -IVD and AI -driven 
digital products.  
• Successful market expansion and drove strategic alliance partnership growth more than double 
times per year.  
• Achieved end -to-end B2B, B2C Business Development strategic alliances deals more than 2 
times growth per year.  
• More than 16 times market share within a ye ar even during the COVID -19 pandemic.  
• Team management responsibilities, cross -continental cross -culture local representatives.  
 
2017 – 2018  
Position: Business De velopment and Sales Manager in Precision Medicine for APAC (focused 
on Japan & China)  
• Identified KOL physicians e.g., oncologists/human geneticists in leading clinics and clinical 
diagnostic labs and arranged face -to-face meetings/seminars.  
• Identifie d partners for joint ventures, cooperation, and local distribution, followed up by LOI and 
cooperation agreement contract negotiations.  
• Cross -function communication with legal counsel and national authorities e.g. PMDA, CFDA  
• Developed comprehensive, cr oss-cultural market entry/sales business strategies for 
international new markets.  
• Successful market entries, e.g., Japan and China.  
 
2016 – 2017 PerkinElmer  
Position: NGS Platform Leader in a CAP certified laboratory  
• Owned and managed about 600,000 € budge t, installed all the equipment, hired the team 
members.  
• Built an NGS technology platform, designed gene panels for diagnostic applications in inherited 
diseases, lead the team to set up a data analysis server and establish a clinical data analysis 
pipeli ne.  
• Organized clinical test validation and generated validation reports for clinical tests.  
• Responsible for NGS team building and management of NGS team members consist of 12 
staff, including technicians, bio -informaticians, and genetic counsellors.  
 
2011 – 2015 German Cancer Research Centre  
Positio n: Senior Scientist  
• Drove ongoing advances in cancer & metabolic type II diabetes, NGS, and data analysis, 
planning and managing projects; with results presented at numerous seminars and scientific 
meetings.  
• Got bioinformatic tr aining for NGS data at EBI. Familiar with UNIX she

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
